intro: Hieracium sinense, commonly known as the Chinese hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with rough, hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its yellow flowers are arranged in a single head, surrounded by pale green bracts, and bloom from June to August. Hieracium sinense is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun conditions.
